name: RiskTheOdds Game
brief: Full stack web-based game built in Flask.
desc: This web app game build in Flask. It aims to be a fun web game that can be picked up and put down whenever!
The app is built as a full-stack web app so that there is integration with a server-side leaderboard that updates when users submit their high scores.
The tools used include Python, Flask, SQLite, Django, and Jinja.

name: JMU CWC Website
brief: Full stack website for JMU Collegiate Wind Competition 2020.
desc: This web app was created as a part of the Collegiate Wind Competition 2020. Our team, James Madison University, took first place in the competition in June 2020. I was able to provide support to the team by designing and building the web app we used for social media and outreach.
This app uses mainly PHP, and the front end is created using bootstrap. It is not currently hosted as the competition has since ended.

name: HackAttack
desc: This is a command line interfaced Python app that I created while as head of the James Madison University Cyber Security Leadership team. I created this in order to demonstrate linux and networking, as well as simulate 'hacking' in a learning environment to students who do not have as much of an experience in Computer Science.
The game uses Python, and is intended to be run on a Linux server - such as a Raspberry Pi.

name: TA Scheduler
brief: Full stack web application that develops and tracks schedules for Teaching Assistants.
desc: This is a full stack web application that I worked on with a team of other students as a part of my Web Development course.
In this project, I focused on the PHP implementation, as well as the calendar integration.

name: JMU Duke BN App
brief: Website for JMU Army ROTC group that tracks members and keeps the group updated.
desc: This is a project that I initially started in order to facilitate tasks in my Army ROTC Battalion at JMU.
The project was very helpful in teaching me web application concepts and gave me a lot of experience in solo development.
Although I did not complete the project on my own, I was able to pass my work to another student who is currently working on it now.

name: Helios 1
brief: 2D Side scrolling game that involves different levels and hazards.
desc: This is a game I created using Processing, a javascript like implementation that is designed for game coding. It was a final project for my computer science program in high school, and I am proud with the work I put into it.

The game takes the player through various levels, as they pilot a ship through sidescrolling 2d space. They must steer around obstacles, and use powerups to disable enemies, while collecting credits and upgrading their ship.

name: 2048 Java
desc: This was a simple game I made that clones the popular mobile app, 2048, using a Java implementation.
